p: Overall, the predicted changes in SRs were larger in the Kinzig compared to the Treene catchment (Figure 5). The mean percentage change in the absolute values for all species and all metrics was significantly higher in the Kinzig compared to the Treene for both time periods. The mean change was 21.6% in the Kinzig, compared to only 13.9% in the Treene catchment for horizon 2050 ( t test, p < .01), while in horizon 2090, it was 19.3% and 14.7% in the Kinzig and Treene, respectively ( t test, p < .01).
